means: close ： 较多地用于正式或庄重的文体中，如关闭铁路、公路以及其它交通渠道，要用close。
shut ： 着重关闭的动作、过程和方式手段。
slam ： 象声词，指"砰的关上"，或用力关上。

sentence.Network_en: Burke cast a cursory glance at the menu, then flapped it shut.
sentence.Network_cn: 伯克匆匆地瞥了一眼菜单，然后啪地合上了。

sentence.Network_en: I let myself out into the street and pulled the door shut.
sentence.Network_cn: 我出门上街并拉上了门。

sentence.Network_en: The envelope has been tampered with and then taped shut again.
sentence.Network_cn: 信封被人动过手脚，然后又用胶带封上了。

lj.lj_ly: I'd be glad to be shut of him.
I'd be glad to be shut of him.
I'd be glad to be shut of him.
I'd be glad to be shut of him.

phrase.cizu_name: shut the stable door after the horse has bolted

lj.lj_ly: I'd be glad to be shut of him.

jx.jx_en_mean: cease trading, either temporarily or permanently

phrase.cizu_name: shut your face (或 mouth 或 trap)!

jx.jx_en_mean: (informal)used as a rude or angry way of telling someone to be quiet
jx.jx_cn_mean: (非正式)（粗鲁或生气时用语）闭嘴！

jx.jx_en_mean: cease (or cause something to cease) business or operation

lj.lj_ly: the plant's operators decided to shut down the reactor.
lj.lj_ls: 工厂的操作员决定停止运行反应堆。

jx.jx_en_mean: keep someone or something inside a place by closing something such as a door

lj.lj_ly: her parents shut her in an upstairs room.
lj.lj_ls: 她父母把她关在楼上的房间里。

jx.jx_en_mean: (used especially in relation to water, electricity, or gas) stop (or cause something to stop) flowing
jx.jx_cn_mean: 关（或切断）（水、电或煤气等）

lj.lj_ly: he was about to shut off the power.

jx.jx_en_mean: keep someone or something out of a place or situation

lj.lj_ly: the door swung to behind them, shutting out some of the noise.
lj.lj_ls: 门旋转到他们后面，把一些噪音隔在外面。

jx.jx_en_mean: [often in imperative](informal)stop (or cause someone to stop) talking
close all doors and windows of a building or room, typically because it will be unoccupied for some time
jx.jx_cn_mean: （因一段时间不居住而）关闭所有门窗

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English scyttan 'put (a bolt) in position to hold fast', of West Germanic origin; related to Dutch schutten 'shut up, obstruct', also to shoot

entry.def: If you shut something such as a door or if it shuts, it moves so that it fills a hole or a space.

example.ex: Just make sure you shut the gate after you...

entry.def: If you shut your eyes, you lower your eyelids so that you cannot see anything.

example.ex: Lucy shut her eyes so she wouldn't see it happen.
example.tran: 露西闭上了眼睛，这样就不会看到它发生了。

entry.def: If your mouth shuts or if you shut your mouth, you place your lips firmly together.

example.ex: Daniel's mouth opened, and then shut again...
example.tran: 丹尼尔嘴巴张了张又合上了。

example.ex: He opened and shut his mouth, unspeaking.

entry.tran: (使)(商店、酒吧等公共场所)关门，停止营业，休息
entry.def: When a store, bar, or other public building shuts or when someone shuts it, it is closed and you cannot use it until it is open again.

example.ex: There is a tendency to shut museums or shops at a moment's notice...
example.tran: 现在博物馆或商店有一种说关就关的趋势。

example.ex: Shops usually shut from noon-3pm, and stay open late...
example.tran: 商店通常中午到下午 3 点关门，然后营业到很晚。

entry.tran: 故意忽视;故意不予理会;对…视若罔闻
entry.def: If you say that someone shuts their eyes to something, you mean that they deliberately ignore something which they should deal with.

example.ex: We shut our eyes to the plainest facts, refusing to admit the truth...
example.tran: 我们对最浅显的事实视而不见，拒绝承认真相。

example.ex: She was shutting her eyes to reality, just as she had done after Matthew died.
example.tran: 她不肯正视现实，跟她在马修去世后的表现如出一辙。

entry.def: If someone tells you to keep your mouth shut about something, they are telling you not to let anyone else know about it.

example.ex: I don't have to tell you how important it is for you to keep your mouth shut about all this...
example.tran: 我不用告诉你，你自己也知道对所有这些事保密有多重要了吧。

example.ex: He paid my brother to kill Norton and keep his mouth shut.
example.tran: 他花钱雇我兄弟去杀了诺顿并给了他封口费。

entry.def: If you keep your mouth shut, you do not express your opinions about something, even though you would like to.

example.ex: If she had kept her mouth shut she would still have her job now.
example.tran: 如果她当时保持沉默的话，她现在工作也就不会丢。

entry.def: If someone tells you to shut your mouth or shut your face, they are telling you very rudely to stop talking.

example.ex: 'Oi, shut your mouth and have respect for elders,' Langda said to the boy.
example.tran: “喂， 闭嘴，对长者要尊重，”兰达对那男孩说。

means.word_mean: 1. move so that an opening or passage is obstructed; make shut;

sentences.sentence: "The windows closed with a loud bang"
"The trees were shutting out all sunlight"
"This policy excludes people who have a criminal record from entering the country"

means.word_mean: 2. used especially of mouth or eyes;

sentences.sentence: "his eyes were shut against the sunlight"

example.en: It's about time to get some shut-eye.
I've got to get some eye-shut before the exam.

auth_sentence.content: Subsequently, Dixie Chicks were all but shut down.
auth_sentence.res_content: Subsequently, Dixie Chicks were all but shut down.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Subsequently, Dixie Chicks were all but shut down.

auth_sentence.content: The plant will remain shut at least until then.
auth_sentence.res_content: The plant will remain shut at least until then.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The plant will remain shut at least until then.

auth_sentence.content: The blowout preventer failed to shut down the well.
auth_sentence.res_content: The blowout preventer failed to shut down the well.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The blowout preventer failed to shut down the well.

Sentence.sentence: These included developing additional domestic sources (such as those on Alaska's North Slope), resuming extraction at sites that had been shut down because of cost inefficiency, capping the price that domestic producers could charge for oil, and beginning to import oil from a greater diversity of nations.

These included developing additional domestic sources (such as those on Alaska's North Slope), resuming extraction at sites that had been shut down because of cost inefficiency, capping the price that domestic producers could charge for oil, and beginning to import oil from a greater diversity of nations.
After the personal-savings rate dipped to zero in 2005, the shock of the economic crisis last year prompted people to snap shut their wallets.

sentences.en: He shut the book and put it away.
sentences.cn: 他把书合起来, 放到一边。

sentences.en: She would shut her eyes tight.

jushi.english: The post office will shut at six pm.
